You should create visual content blocker: You should create visual content blockers for these services, if the services display visual elements, or disable them for your website! The following services are affected:
You have decided to obtain consent witho: You have decided to obtain consent without cookie banners (banner-less consent) on your website. At the same time, some non-essential services, which requires a consent, doese not have visual content blockers, which is why website visitors without cookie banners cannot consent to them (except via the legal link to change the privacy settings).
Check whether there really is a legitima: Check whether there really is a legitimate interest in the legal sense according to {{a}}Art. 6 (1) (f) GDPR{{/a}}, which is only given in rare cases!
At the same time, you use the following: At the same time, you use the following non-essential services on the legal basis of a legitimate interest:
You have decided to obtain consent witho: You have decided to obtain consent without cookie banners (banner-less consent) on your website. This means that when your website visitors visit your website for the first time, they will not know that you use this service on the basis of a legitimate interest and can object to it. They will need to read your cookie policy or privacy policy to find out.
Enable consent to data processing in uns: Enable consent to data processing in unsafe third countries
Consents before %s has been automaticall: Consents before %s has been automatically deleted according to the settings you have made.
Also, you can export documented consents: Also, you can export documented consents to save them in a local backup.
You can export and import all or only so: You can export and import all or only some of the settings you made in Real Cookie Banner. If you have several websites, you can save a lot of time by transferring the settings comfortably.
Hiding these options, e.g. in the privac: Hiding these options, e.g. in the privacy policy, is in the opinion of multiple data protection authorities in the EU a violation of the GDPR.
Are you sure you want to disable this se: Are you sure you want to disable this service?
Real Cookie Banner is brought to you wit: Real Cookie Banner is brought to you with {{icon/}} by
You have not yet defined a %s service. T: You have not yet defined a %s service. To use {{strong}}%s{{/strong}} with Real Cookie Banner, you must create the appropriate service.
Your {{code}}wp-content{{\/code}} folder: Your {{code}}wp-content{{/code}} folder is not writable. Please check your permissions!
The cookie banner is activated, but unfo: The cookie banner is activated, but unfortunately you have not yet created or enabled services.
If you have created a new service like G: If you have created a new service like Google Analytics (without visual content blocker), previous visitors can never consent without collecting new consents and you cannot track them, for example.
Consent must be obtained in accordance w: Consent must be obtained in accordance with {{a}}Art. 7 GDPR{{/a}}. Your visitor must be informed about all circumstances of the consent. However, you have made changes to your cookie banner, which lead to the fact that previously visitors have consented differently or to something different than is now in the cookie banner. Therefore, previously collected consents may have become partially invalid.
Are you sure you don't want to collect n: Are you sure you don't want to collect new consents?
You have changed settings that affect th: You have changed settings that affect the content or behavior of the cookie banner. You should ask all visitors for their consent again.
We have collected all relevant steps for: We have collected all relevant steps for the legally compliant use of Real Cookie Banner after the first installation. Set up the cookie banner step by step to add a cookie banner to your website in compliance with the ePrivacy Directive and GDPR.
How time flies! You have installed Real: How time flies! You have installed Real Cookie Banner some time ago, but you still haven't finished the configuration yet.
What is a TCF vendor? According to the I: What is a TCF vendor? According to the IAB Europe Transparency & Consent Framework (TCF), any service (e.g. Google for Google Ads) that wants to use consents according to the TCF standard must register as a vendor in the {{a}}Global Vendor List (GVL){{/a}}. All TCF vendors specify for which purposes they need consent to process data and set cookies and which features they can offer with these consents. They also provide a link to their privacy policy for further information. You, as a website operator, must obtain consent in your cookie banner for all vendors you work with. You can limit the requested purposes of vendors to keep consents as privacy-friendly as possible.
To meet the requirements of the TCF stan: To meet the requirements of the TCF standard, the shortcodes should be placed near the link to the privacy policy.
Consents are automatically documented in: Consents are automatically documented in order to be able to prove compliance with the legal requirements according to {{a}}Art. 5 GDPR{{/a}} and, in case of dispute, to prove how the consent was obtained.
What is a content blocker? Imagine that: What is a content blocker? Imagine that a user of your website does not accept all services. At the same time, you have integrated e.g. a YouTube video that sets cookies that the visitor has not agreed to. According to the ePrivacy Directive, this is prohibited. Content blockers automatically replace iframes, script and link tags like YouTube videos for such users and offer them to watch the video as soon as they agree to load it.
What are services? Services can be exter: What are services? Services can be external applications such as Google Analytics or WordPress plugins or themes that process personal data (e.g. IP address) and/or set cookies. Cookies (and similar technologies) are small text files that are stored on the device of visitors to your website. You can store information about the visitor in cookies, such as the website's language, or unique advertising IDs to display personalized advertising. You, as the site owner, must ensure that cookies are only placed on your visitors' devices and personal data are only processed if they have given their explicit consent. Unless you have a legitimate interest in the legal sense to do so even without consent. You can define here all the services you use and their cookies with their legal and technical information.
Just by using the scanner, you will not: Just by using the scanner, you will not set up your cookie banner one hundred percent correctly. If it is too complex or time-consuming for you to set up the cookie banner yourself, just let one of our {{a}}cookie experts{{/a}} set it up for you!
Complete coverage of your individual use: Complete coverage of your individual use case
Services embedded after the page load vi: Services embedded after the page load via JavaScript
Automatic check of all subpages of your: Automatic check of all subpages of your website
WordPress plugins with templates that re: WordPress plugins with templates that require consent
We explicitly do not find cookies becaus: We explicitly do not find cookies because that would not work reliably. {{a}}We explained why in our knowledge base.{{/a}}
The scanner finds services that you use: The scanner finds services that you use on your website that might set/read cookies or process personal data. This is e.g. Google Analytics, YouTube or Elementor. If there is no template for a service, you will see from which external URLs content, scripts etc. are embedded. This allows you to set up your cookie banner quickly and easily.
Content Blockers are globally deactivate: Content Blockers are globally deactivated in the settings and are therefore not displayed on your website.
Your website visitors must be able to vi: Your website visitors must be able to view their consent history, change their consent, or withdraw their consent at any time. This must be as easy as giving consent. Therefore, the legal links must be included on every subpage of the website (e.g. in the footer).
